intro: Psychotria leucocarpa var. rotundata, commonly known as the white-fruited psychotria, is a species native to parts of Central and South America. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically white or pale green when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
